This is nice, a must buy if you own half life. The crossover fan service is pretty good. It's telling a story of how the opposing team sees this guy name "Gordon" as a villain. Before you play this, you gotta forget about Freeman's whole story (haha get it? forget about freeman? KILL ME). Cause you're not a scientist anymore, you're a soldier.

But the downside is... The weapons looks like it came from a different game, the machine gun looks like it came from postal 2. And the plot kinda lazy... Another race of alien shit, attacking black mesa again...

Overall, this expansion pack is pretty cool, and some new enemy is very challenging in a good way.

A very dated game that basically does what Half Life did but poorly. There are some more chaotic levels that involve less tactic and more RNG, it brings back those terrible platforming levels on Xen (albeit not many thankfully) and puzzles that require you to do things in a specific sequence that's not explained or hinted at or otherwise risk getting soft-locked and starting over again (i.e. that Pit Worms chapter). In between these events is mostly silence occasionally broken up by a random alien spawning out of nowhere. The sewer level is probably the worst offender being both buggy and tedious.

And don't get me started on the buggy AI, Black OPS will have Einsteins IQ when attacking you but your allies will struggle to commit to the basic task of following you even though path-finding is literally built into each map. I have no idea how they messed that up. Oh yeah, and if you thought the Black OPS were challenging enough the game spawns them behind you in the chapter 'Worlds Collide' just to piss you off.

Now there are some good things about this game; it has a wide selection of weapons, new alien species and some nicely designed areas but I struggle to find anything nice to say other than that.

The result of all this is an exhausting experience that ends up being more frustrating than fun.
рекомендую

This game has an amazing story, new weapons, great level design, lots of enemy types and much more, so it must mean it's a great game, right? Well, yes, it is, but an awful amount of bugs and glitches sometimes made me angry. I have experienced countless crashes, corrupted saves, many times I got stuck inside walls and sometimes levels bugged. The AI of your friendly marines can sometimes be annoying as hell, also the graphics and controls also didn't age well. It's a great game if you can withstand those things and if you like classic games. I would like this game on sale instead of the full price. If its on sale its usually -80%, sometimes even -90% or you can get it in a package with some other games. btw i forgot to mention you probably can download some patches but i never tried.
If you love Half-Life, you'll love this game. Definitely recommend.

Мне зашёл оригинал, так что дополнительная сюжетка Opposing Force пришлась очень кстати и зашла на ура!
Вышло хорошее дополнение к первому Half-Life. Завезли новых противников, оружие и допилили полноценную механику напарников. Единственное, что сильно бросается в глаза - это то, что охранники Black Mesa невраждебно относятся к военному. В остальном дополнение вышло отличное!
Так что смело советую к прохождению после оригинальной первой части Half-Life!

This game gave me a virus!

I so happen that I finally got "Half-Life: Opposing Force". I was so ready to play the game so I started to install the game, but then the steam cloud sync popped out. I try to ignore the popup but it won't go away so did what I didn't know what to do. I press something of what it said and then the game opened up as it should be, but something also popup and it said geekbuddy on the bottom right corner. I realized that this game I paid for, gave me a virus, I was so lucky that my computer rebooted itself. I thought If I opened the game, this time there won't be a popup and I won't need to press any option but oh, I was so wrong. It happen again like last time. I had to live with this virus for a year then my computer rebooted itself again. I knew I will never open that game again and I told my brother not to open any games that's using goldsource engine. I'm scared to revisit that experience again so I will never touch the game ever again. Valve can't give me a refund on this game so as I'm writing this, I will give this review out to warn other people to be careful of what you buy on steam, your computer maybe got a virus.

Единственная ценность, которую представляет оппозинг форс в 2022 году это сюжет и взгляд на события со стороны HECU. Геймдизайн сильно протух и сильно слабее чем в хл1: 
-это и вечные лабиринты с тупиками и непониманием куда идти потому что выход спрятан гдет в темном углу, 
-это и куча бесполезного оружия с 5-10 патронами на каждое потому что стволов в аддоне больше чем боеприпасов, 
-это и давящие мясом черные оперативнки(!) вместе с xen вторженцами,
-нереализованная система боев с напарниками, по сюжету надо пару раз воспользоваться услугами инженера и все, в остальное время солдаты просто бегут вперед и помирают,
-дисбаланс расположения аптечек, часто их нет на огромных промежутках, а иногда завались просто.

Adrian Shepard

An amazing expansion to an already awesome game. Half Life was already a good experience for me with it's cryptic story about aliens and government cover ups, fast paced game play and all the charm of a 1998 shooter, but this expansion pushed that formula even further beyond for me. Opposing Force is a perfect example of how to make an expansion the right way. There's more weapon varieties, alien enemies, and chaotic battles to be fought with Adrian Shephard inside the Black Mesa Research Complex. This expansion scratches the half life itch I felt when I beat the first game. One small issue I had with the game was the AI for the marine partners breaking a lot for me and it happened frequently enough where I got annoyed at the game for a little bit but in the end it didn't ruin the experience for me. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who loves Half Life and FPS games.
